sentences.en: He has written a fine preface to the play.
sentences.cn: 他为这个剧本写了一篇精彩的序言.

sentences.en: I have read this preface of book.
sentences.cn: 我已读过这本书的前言.

sentences.en: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 进入正题之前，我先引用莎士比亚的几句诗作为开场白。

sentences.en: In his preface the author set forth his reasons for writing the book.
sentences.cn: 作者在前言中阐明了他写这本书的原因.

sentences.en: Our defeat may be the preface to our successor's victory.
sentences.cn: 我们的失败可能是我们后继者获胜的开端.

sentences.en: Several pages of closely reasoned argument preface her account of the war.
sentences.cn: 她那部关于战争的著述之前有几页论证严谨的序言.

sentences.en: That dictionary has a preface, not a foreword.
sentences.cn: 那部词典有一篇序文, 不是前言.

sentences.en: The accident was the preface to a great scientific discovery.
sentences.cn: 这一偶然事件成了一项重大科学发现的前奏.

sentences.en: The book has a preface written by the author.
The preface is complete in itself.
sentences.cn: 这前言本身就是完整的.

sentences.en: The preface of the book includes an account of the author's life.
sentences.cn: 该书前言记述了作者生平.

sentences.en: The preface to this book is on the preceding page.
sentences.cn: 前边一页是这本书的序言.

sentences.en: The subject has been referred to cursorily in the preface.
sentences.cn: 这个问题在序言中已粗略地提到了.

sentences.en: The wine before you may serve for a preface.
sentences.cn: 你面前的葡萄酒也许能当作引子.

sentences.en: This book has a preface written by the author.
sentences.cn: 这本书有作者写的序言.

trans.tran_cn: 序言，引语，开端，前奏，[宗]（弥撒的）序诵，序祷
trans.tran_en: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech

trans.tran_cn: 为…写序言,以…为开端；作…的开场白
trans.tran_en: If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first
